channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report X-2023110124
item.description:
Report X-2023110124

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: OAK PARK
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was put overhead and damage upon getting to loading belt, QA used hazmat tote, plastic bags and absorbent pads DescribePack: dent on bottom of package caused lid to pop off and spill DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: paint was put right side up and lid popped back on

item.title: Report X-2023110115
item.description:
Report X-2023110115

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: PORTAGE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package discovered by PH in Load area leaking with side & bottom of box wet. Package was removed from area, placed in a HazMat tote, and taken to HazMat cage using proper PPE, where it was discovered that cap from one jug came loose, causing roughly 1.67 L to spill out. DescribePack: Loose cap, internal leakage DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed from area, placed in a HazMat tote, and taken to HazMat cage using proper PPE

item.title: Report E-2023110188
item.description:
Report E-2023110188

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: YPSILANTI
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A 5-G pail of Speed Line lacquer spilled/released (5) G inside of trailer SF0826 near dock door 168 and pro 368496072. Shipper is PPG UN1263 Paint, PG II. The material was cleaned with absorbent and all materials were placed into an overpack for proper disposal. Cause of damage- forked by forklift operator at the terminal.

item.title: Report E-2023110127
item.description:
Report E-2023110127

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: SAGINAW
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While loading out of the facility these drums were on a pallet double stacked in the warehouse and when lifting the pallet up to be loaded the back corner of the pallet gave out allowing the drum to fall off hitting another container causing a puncture in the drum. The release happened in the containment area of the warehouse. They immediately called for a response team and put down absorbent material down to help with the mediation. The response team arrived and dawned the appropriate PPE and proceeded to conduct the clean up. The drum and absorbent material that was used to conduct the clean up was transferred into a salvage drum and disposed of in accordance with the regulations.

item.title: Report E-2023110126
item.description:
Report E-2023110126

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: BATTLE CREEK
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: (6) (1-G) pails arrived stacked on and crushed in transit releasing (.5) of a G into trailer #OE1338. No known drains or waterways impacted, spill was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a poly over pack. Damage caused by unprotected freight, no dunnage used.

item.title: Report X-2023101506
item.description:
Report X-2023101506

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: MADISON HEIGHTS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO LEAKING HAZ-MAT PACKAGE. RESPONDER DISCOVERED CONTENTS TO BE CONVO-CLEAN FORTE- CORROSIVE 8 POTASSIUM HYDROXIDE SOLUTION 8 PGII. CAPS ON 2-2.5 GALLON CONTAINERS FOUND TO BE LOOSE. THE SHIPPING CARTON WAS DAMP. RESPONDER POURED 2-2.5 GALLON CONTAINERS IN NEW 5 GALLON PAIL SEALED THE PAIL SHUT. PLACED 5 GALLON PAIL IN GREEN DMP BAG ALONG WITH DAMP CARDBOARD, PAPER TOWELS, AND ZEP ZORBENT.
